chinese: [C] 干枝条；干柳条；芦苇杆
bad-tempered and easily annoyed 脾气坏的；易怒的
examples: e.g. I have not had enough sleep lately and I am feeling kind of [[grumpy]].

chinese: (BrE visualise) form a picture of sb. / sth. in your mind 设想；想象
examples: e.g. An architect can look at a drawing and [[visualize]] a three-dimensional shape.

chinese: 1) [C] a piece of work that a student is asked to do （学生的）作业
examples: e.g. Students will need to complete three written [[assignments]] this semester.；e.g. She told me that she will be in Greece next week on [[assignment]] for one of the national newspapers.

chinese: 2) [C, U] a piece of work that is given to sb. as part of their job （分配的）任务
examples: e.g. Students will need to complete three written [[assignments]] this semester.；e.g. She told me that she will be in Greece next week on [[assignment]] for one of the national newspapers.

chinese: laugh at sb. or shout rude remarks at them to show that you do not respect them 嘲笑；嘲弄
examples: e.g. After the match, the disappointed fans were all [[jeering]] at the football team.

chinese: (not in progressive) surprise or upset sb. so much that they do not react immediately 使（某人）震惊
examples: e.g. Sasha was too [[stunned]] by what had happened in the office to say a word.

chinese: (fml.) (~ with) continue doing sth. that has already been started; continue being done 继续进行；继续做
examples: e.g. The discussions between the two firms are [[proceeding]] slowly but satisfactorily.

chinese: form or make sth. form a curved shape（使）拱起；（使）成拱形
examples: e.g. His eyebrows [[arched]] as if he were angry.

chinese: [C] 眉（毛）
raise one's shoulders slightly to express doubt, indifference, ignorance, etc. 耸（肩）（以示怀疑、 与己无关、不知道等）
examples: e.g. He [[shrugged]] his shoulders as if to say that there was nothing he could do about it.

chinese: [C] a house or an area of a city that is in very bad condition, where very poor people live （城市中的）贫民窟，贫民区
examples: e.g. My friend Bobby lives with his three sisters in a [[slum]] near the city center, but he doesn't lose faith in life.

chinese: marketable goods, skills, etc. can be sold easily because people want them （商品、技能等）有市场的，有销路的，畅销的
examples: e.g. The program is designed to provide students with real, [[marketable]] skills.

chinese: showing too much satisfaction with your own cleverness or success — used to show disapproval 自满的，自鸣得意的，沾沾自喜的（含贬义）
examples: e.g. Peter was wearing an unbearably [[smug]] expression and waving the tickets in front of me.

chinese: [C] an unpleasant look suggesting lust or ill will 挑逗性的或不怀好意的目光
examples: e.g. He has a most unpleasant [[leer]].

chinese: [C]1) [usu. pl.] the length, height, width, depth or diameter of sth. 大小；尺寸
examples: e.g. It is important to measure the exact [[dimensions]] of the room before buying furniture.；e.g. You can have a spiritual [[dimension]] to your life without being religious.

chinese: 2) a part of a situation or a quality involved in it （形势或品质的）方面，层面
examples: e.g. It is important to measure the exact [[dimensions]] of the room before buying furniture.；e.g. You can have a spiritual [[dimension]] to your life without being religious.

chinese: think about sth. seriously for a period of time 深思；细想
examples: e.g. As he lay in his hospital bed that night, he cried as he [[contemplated]] his future.；e.g. Many years ago he had [[contemplated]] writing a book about his childhood.

chinese: think about sth. that you might do in the future 打算；想；考虑
examples: e.g. As he lay in his hospital bed that night, he cried as he [[contemplated]] his future.；e.g. Many years ago he had [[contemplated]] writing a book about his childhood.

chinese: [C] a large building for storing large quantities of goods 仓库；货栈
examples: e.g. Police are investigating a fire at a furniture [[warehouse]].

chinese: 1) [C] a single seed of corn, wheat, etc. 谷粒
examples: e.g. Mum must have left in a hurry, since there were quite a few [[grains]] of corn left on the floor.；e.g. The government intends to import only five percent of the country's [[grain]].

chinese: 2) [U] the seeds of crops such as corn, wheat or rice that are gathered for use as food, or these crops themselves 谷物；粮食
examples: e.g. Mum must have left in a hurry, since there were quite a few [[grains]] of corn left on the floor.；e.g. The government intends to import only five percent of the country's [[grain]].

chinese: relating to industry or the people working in it 工业的；产业工人的
examples: e.g. Reports showed [[industrial]] production rose 1.3 percent in November from the month before.

chinese: [U] (also revenues) money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, esp. from selling goods or services （公司、机构的）收益，收入
examples: e.g. These companies are sure to encounter financial trouble if they only rely on advertising [[revenue]] for funding.

chinese: [C] a person whose job is to kill animals such as rats or mice, because they are annoying or dangerous 职业的消灭害虫者
examples: e.g. Can you believe that nearly one hundred million rats are killed each year by pest [[exterminators]]?

chinese: a plan, idea, or method that is feasible is possible and is likely to work （计划、想法或方法）可行的，可实行的，行得通的
examples: e.g. It was no longer financially [[feasible]] to keep the community center open.

chinese: look angrily at sb. for a long time 怒目而视
examples: e.g. Noah was furious at what I just said but he didn't shout and just [[glared]] at me silently.

chinese: in a way that is deliberately meant to show that you are annoyed, bored, or disapprove of sth. 明确地；尖锐地；直言不讳地
examples: e.g. Miss Phillips looked at the clock [[pointedly]] and I realized that it was time for me to leave.

chinese: [C]1) a complaint 抱怨
examples: e.g. They've got the usual moans and [[groans]] like everybody else.；e.g. The rescuers could hear the [[groans]] of someone trapped in the ruins.

chinese: 2) a long deep sound that you make when you are in pain or do not want to do sth. （疼痛时的）呻吟；（不愿做某事时的）哼哼声
examples: e.g. They've got the usual moans and [[groans]] like everybody else.；e.g. The rescuers could hear the [[groans]] of someone trapped in the ruins.

chinese: loud enough for you to hear it 听得见的
examples: e.g. His voice was barely [[audible]] above the noise of the crowd.

chinese: stop sb. from continuing what they are saying or doing by suddenly speaking to them, making a noise, etc. 打断某人的讲话；中断某人的行动；打扰
examples: e.g. I'm sorry to [[interrupt]] your meeting, but may I speak to Michael for a moment?

chinese: [C] (fml.)1) sth. that is certain to be successful 稳操胜券的事
examples: e.g. His new movie is predicted by many critics to be this season's [[slam]] [[dunk]] hit.；e.g. He marked his first appearance with a [[slam]] [[dunk]] for his first points.

chinese: 2) (in basketball) the act of jumping up and putting the ball through the net with a lot of force 强力灌篮；扣篮
examples: e.g. His new movie is predicted by many critics to be this season's [[slam]] [[dunk]] hit.；e.g. He marked his first appearance with a [[slam]] [[dunk]] for his first points.

chinese: (fml.) repeating the actual words that were spoken or written 逐字的（地）；一字不差的（地）
examples: e.g. The president's speeches are regularly reproduced [[verbatim]] in the state-run newspapers.

chinese: if leaves, papers, clothes, etc. rustle, or if you rustle them, they move about and make a soft, dry sound （使）（树叶、纸、衣物等）沙沙作响
examples: e.g. A gentle breeze blew through the windows, lightly [[rustling]] the curtains.

chinese: done quickly and with a lot of activity, but in a way that is not very well organized 紧张忙乱的；手忙脚乱的
examples: e.g. People were [[frantic]], trying to call relatives after the earthquake.

chinese: done in a hurried way and in a state of excitement or confusion 手忙脚乱地
examples: e.g. I've been working [[frantically]] all week to get the term paper finished before the deadline.

chinese: (pl. indexes) an alphabetical list of names, subjects, etc. at the back of a book, with the numbers of the pages where they can be found （书后的）索引
examples: e.g. Look under B in the [[index]] to see if biology is covered in the book.

chinese: 1) (also ~ enough) used to say that sth. seems strange or surprising 奇怪的是；真奇怪
examples: e.g. [[Oddly]] enough, someone asked me the same question yesterday.；e.g. Didn't you think she was behaving very [[oddly]] at Susan's birthday party yesterday?

chinese: 2) in a strange or unusual way 奇怪地；古怪地；异常地
examples: e.g. [[Oddly]] enough, someone asked me the same question yesterday.；e.g. Didn't you think she was behaving very [[oddly]] at Susan's birthday party yesterday?

chinese: used to say the opposite of a situation you have just described is also true 反之亦然
examples: e.g. He refuses to believe anything they say and vice versa.

chinese: stop doing sth. that is failing, so that one does not waste any more money, time, or effort 及早脱手以减少损失
examples: e.g. [[Cut]] your losses with projects that are not going to work and do things that make you feel comfortable.

chinese: put your possessions into a bag, etc. before leaving a place （在离开前）收好物品
examples: e.g. We arrived just as the musicians were [[packing]] up their instruments.

chinese: have a big smile on your face that clearly shows you are happy or amused 咧着嘴笑
examples: e.g. He tiptoed closer, [[smiling]] broadly, waiting for Suzanne to spot him.

chinese: make sth. less or smaller 削减
examples: e.g. Some business owners are [[cutting]] into their profits to help raise money for the foundation.

chinese: used to say that a particular choice would be more satisfactory 更好的选择是
examples: e.g. I started to hunt for a cheap restaurant nearby or, better still, a snack shop.

chinese: give sth. to each person in a group 分发；散发
examples: e.g. He was busy [[handing]] out leaflets on the musical to the audience.

chinese: find an explanation or solution to a problem, by thinking all the possibilities （通过推理）解释，解决
examples: e.g. I spent the entire night [[reasoning]] out the solution to the puzzle.

chinese: think carefully about the possible results of sth. 认真地考虑（某事可能产生的结果）
examples: e.g. People need time to [[think]] through what the changes in taxation will mean for them.

chinese: 杰克 • 维克特（人名）
